author: S Senthalir
text:
A seven-year old boy, studying in a private school in Uppalam, died on Sunday morning hours after being bitten by a poisonous insect. Parents alleged negligence by school administration.

Seshadri Prashanth, who was studying in second standard in Amalorpavam School in Vanarpet, had complained of insect bite. Immediately, he was taken to the school dispensary and given medical aid.

His parents were alerted and they took him to a nearby hospital. But he fell unconscious and was admitted to the Indira Gandhi Government General Hospital. As his health further deteriorated. he was taken to JIPMER hospital. But he died on Sunday morning.

Agitated over the alleged negligence of school authorities, the parents threatened to stage a demonstration in the school.

However, the local MLA intervened and talks were held with the administration, following which, the protest was given up.
title: 7-year-old boy dies of insect bite in Uppalam
